intro: Tetranthera gullavara, commonly known as the Gullavara tetranthera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions of Indonesia and Papua New Guinea. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems, which are typical features of the genus Tetranthera. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and understudied species in botanical research.
